page.title: 16INTERVIEW - Mr.E.P.RICHARDS
page.content: I have lived in Gilfach for 67 years. School was very different when I was a child, we didn't have the same freedom or facilities. We could get more for our pounds shillings and pence. We could go to the cinema for 2d. and sweets 1d. for a large bag. Shoes cost 5sh. a pair. The village was very different e.g. The Welfare near the school used to be a quarry - there was a coal level up behind the school and the trams used to come down past the school, drawn by horses, right down to the railway where the coal was loaded onto trucks. There was no main road to cross then, the new road from Ystrad Mynach to Bargoed had not been built and the land between Pengam and Gilfach was mainly wooded. "Charity Wood" it was called. Life was a lot slower in those days.
